review_title: Sorry to say the other reviews are true 😔
pros: Benefits (though they could be better)
cons: While it’s a benefit in some ways, working remotely inevitable isolates employees from each other. The Senior Leaders seem to regularly connect in person, but the rest of us don’t have the benefit of camaraderie. I just read the other reviews here and they are totally true — there is a toxic disconnect from the top down. Yet I didn’t know other people shared the experience I’ be had until I read the reviews on Glassdoor! The HR and executive teams manage to keep employees disconnected while instilling a paranoia in us all. And so we just trudge along doing our jobs, telling ourselves we’re here for the mission.

pros: Competitive salary, free snack and meals.
cons: Corporate culture, lack of frameworks.

review_title: Ambitious, Game-Changing Bridge Between What Was for Women in the Workplace and What Can Be
pros: Powerful and insightful change agents helping to bring fairness, rigor and achievement to help women and at work. Tireless. Inclusive. Diverse. Bridging gap between corporations and their employees with research. Newly energized by a fearless new ceo who reminds us of Catalyst's founder Felice Schwartz. A real leader.
cons: Change can be tough. Not all who have worked here for years are up for it. Some may be invested in comfortable status quo. Those who can’t keep up can get nasty. Real leaders listen, but don’t get thrown off course by petty complaints. Our course is transformational for the organization and women in the workplace. Worth it.

pros: great environment and company to work with
cons: no cons at this time

pros: Amazing mission and even more powerful research. Great people who are fierce advocates and passionate about impact and change.
cons: All People are not valued. Leaders are not following the research on being Inclusive Leaders. WOC are leaving. Process/policy overrides people.

review_title: Great place to do mission driven work
pros: Incredible team, mission and opportunity to be innovation in a growth environment. Amazing flexible environment.
cons: Lots of priorities to juggle

job_title: Senior Associate in New York, NY
pros: Very mission-driven--the work is meaningful. Great colleagues. Sophisticated research.
cons: At times the workload is heavy, but that is not surprising given how in demand the info and work from Catalyst is.

job_title: Resource and Referral Specialist in South Lake Tahoe, CA
pros: I have nothing good to say.
cons: No structure to the role, team, and systems.

pros: Good salary. Great PTO and flex. Many passionate people.
cons: Catalyst feels like the titanic heading fast towards an ice berg right. It would be ok to go down with the ship if you felt Sr. Leadership cared--but I think they would be tossing us aside to grab the few lifeboats. I am sorry to say the culture is toxic. I should not have left my previous job

pros: Lots of flexibility. Half days on Fridays. Remote work. Some interesting work.
cons: The culture is toxic. Everyone is updating their resume and bolting. The senior leadership doesn't practice what the company preaches --lots of backbiting and finger-pointing to cover incompetence and protect turfs. The overwork is ridiculous.

pros: Company-wide commitment to gender equity
cons: Long interview process from application submission to job offer

job_title: Director of Development in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Diverse, advance women, great time off.
cons: Hiring process consists of 4-5 interviews

pros: The leadership, colleagues and culture are all amazing. Best experience that I have ever had at any organization
cons: The pay is a little low, but that is only because it is a non-profit organization

review_title: Join if you like family office
pros: The timings are fixed 8-5pm
cons: Micro managed, no growth opportunity

pros: lovely staff and flexible working environment
cons: there are no cons that I have come across

pros:
- Kind/welcoming colleagues
- Passionate employees committed to DEI
- Great flexible-work
- Interesting research on women
cons:
The company does not practice what it preaches.
- Leadership of regions = all white women, in a company advocating diversity.
- High employee turnover
- Complete lack of transparency around promotions/salary 
- Some great leaders/but some are horrific who create toxic work environments.

pros: Multi-Disciplined approach in venture capital
cons: None, absolutely professional organization with many divisons

pros: This company pros you have your own vehicle
cons: Yes poor management, poor job no growth

pros: good very accoumudating to me.
cons: medium salary that aint enough

pros: The mission and the content shared with companies across the world has an impact and has changed the way - and continues to change the way - women are treated in the workforce.
cons: Really it’s a lack of “practice what you preach”. There were quite a of  issues and when highlighted to upper management, mid-management’s response was shockingly retaliatory, no ownership or insight on any of the concerns flagged and a literal response of “ you should have just let it go”. Upper management too busy to follow up - a culture where feedback is punished is not heathy.

pros:
- Great Catalyst mission, please let's keep the focus on impact and mission. Most employees are passionate and truly live the mission daily.
- Healthy and very positive team culture where constructive feedback is encouraged, especially within the MARC team and LAS department.
- Hard working team members that support each other. Very respectful.
- Fantastic research available & thought leadership content.
- Personal growth and learning opportunities.
- Flexibility.
- Diverse , equitable, and inclusive culture.
cons:
- Workload can at times feel heavy (Quality must prevail over quantity)
- Marketing support can be improved, but the management is working on it though.

pros: Ever since starting at Catalyst I’ve been shown nothing but respect trust and collaboration. Great teams and a great mission with very passionate people.
cons: If I had to say anything, I would say workload is a bit much sometimes but everyone is willing to help out if needed.

pros: Too many where do i start
cons: Racist too many weekly coffee mornings and team meetings with no agenda or minutes

pros:
Support
Compensation
Ability to create my own path
Accessible resources
Open team environment
Work Life Balance
cons: New York Taxes regardless of the state you live in

job_title: Vice President in New York, NY
pros: Strong mission, commitment to DEI, very flexible, great benefits.
cons: Very revenue focused for a non-profit

pros: Incredible, fun culture with unbelievable support for career growth. I've truly never worked any place like it. Remote work available.
cons: I have not found any cons.

pros: Mission centered work with a valuable cause
cons: Fully remote with no hybrid option if you are outside nyc

pros: good for working pros and good benefits
cons: none really to specify and good benefits

job_title: Front Desk in San Diego, CA
pros: Friendly coworkers occasionally, work keeps you on your toes
cons: Cliques, management could use work, difficulty moving up in position

pros: Great group of people with opportunities for development.
cons: I would prefer to have more contact

pros: The Catalyst team is very passionate about their mission!
cons: As with all nonprofits, it's about makings sure that resources are focused on what is most important.

job_title: Senior Associate in New York, NY
pros: Flexibility, Leadership opportunities, diverse staff
cons: 2 year track to promote

pros: alot of work load while at work
cons: not enough people for the crew

pros: Deborah Gillis, the former CEO is gone, and that is great news for Catalyst.  She was a poor leader who nearly killed company morale through her own actions (or inactions), and hiring at least one truly terrible person. The organization is bouncing back though, thanks to our interim CEO and now our new CEO. It's true, bad leadership can ruin everything and good leadership can change it. The mission and people of Catalyst are its best qualities. Now we have leadership again to accelerate those.
cons: Hasn't quite achieved its desire to be "nimble."

review_title: Do you want constant stress and drama in your life? Then work at Catalyst!
pros:
Some flex time
Nice office
Dress code not really enforced
cons:
Toxic culture. Drama, drama, drama
Management is horrendous. If you need something done, it'll be done within the next five to ten years. Dead weight all around. Some managers can barely work a computer. Not even sure if God could fix that. 
High turnover and HR that turns a blind eye. 
Salaries are depressingly low for an organization that claims to work for women. If you're just starting out, you'd probably make more money as a Walmart stock associate. 
Everyone is constantly stressed. Overworked and underpaid is not a good combo.

review_title: Great if you like work-life balance, not great if you want your career to go anywhere.
job_title: Senior Associate in New York, NY
pros: Schedule flexibility, options to work virtually, health & retirement benefits.
cons: For all the research and best practices we promote to other companies, we certainly don't do any of it ourselves. With recent executive changes over the past few years, culture has become toxic, so people have been leaving in droves, and it doesn't look like it's slowing down anytime soon. I don't know anyone who is still here who is happy.

review_title: Internally a bit of a mess
pros: good and worthy cause if youre a rich woman CEO who wants to sit on a board. coworkers are very passionate and most are kind and full of knowledge, except some people act as if they are curing cancer and not making wealthy women more wealthy. a few recent EC resignations are good, that should help move us past the drama.
cons:
-bad management. executives are not really executives and it shows.
-keep bad employees on board too long, takes morale away from hard workers. they dont like to admit when they hired bad and get rid of the employees. some are very useless and yet work here for 20 years. 
-tech is really far behind the times
-leadership is too involved in day to day tasks, its as if they dont trust who they have hired. a ton of red tape for an organization so small.
-a lot of emotional managing, cant get past personal likes and dislikes, gives the notion that women cant make business decisions credence. 
-some really horrible behaviors are acceptable by some and not by others, seems as if there are 'chosen' employees who are allowed to be nasty to people and get promoted, and also some who are given jobs and responsibilities they are not fit for nor are they excelling in at all.
-they say they are listening to us employees and what we want, but that doesn't seem to be translating in policy or process. they seem clueless.
-some hiring decisions and promotions make no sense.
-theyve been told time and again about dead weight, but it never goes away. 
-with the positive EC resignations, they then stick two people on the EC who make no sense. one person who is just a terrible person and manager and another who is meek as can be and won't stand up for anything. more of the same i guess. may be time to start sending the resume out.

review_title: Once a great organization, now fallen way behind others in the space
job_title: Corporate Communications Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Very well known organization
Incredible company members who support the organization (Apple, Intel, ConAgra, UPS, among many others)
Great hours (35 hour work week, 1/2 day Fridays throughout the year)
cons:
Researchers have too much authority and control over how things are done within the organization
Many of the executives do little, while everyone else has to pick up their slack
Other similar organizations have been more aggressive in their PR programs, leaving Catalyst in the past

pros: A fun, casual place to work with a solid team. It feels good to sell something that helps young people achieve their goals. Also - no cold calling! There’s a steady influx of hot leads to call and people who want to talk to you. A decidedly not-salesy approach is encouraged and daily calls feel conversational and consultative rather than like typical hard-selling.
cons: Better lead management/tracking CRM to help us keep track of all the inbound inquiries would be helpful, but leadership is already outlining a plan to help with this

review_title: One of the best in terms of mission and culture
pros: Great colleagues who are smart and committed to excellence; the ability to get involved in multiple projects (some international); amazing work-life balance and benefits.
cons: none that are significant; salaries are a little lower but the trade-off in work-life balance and benefits are worth it.

review_title: Smart People but high burn out rates
pros: Smart and kind colleagues that truly care about you.
cons: Top heavy organization of people with long tenure therefore no where to go, with no support people

pros: The people are great and some clients are nice to work with. Really good training and learning experiences.
cons: The pay, working with disorganized agency teams. Promotions don't come when you have earned them, they only come twice per year when new york approves them in bulk.

pros: Positive work environment, great mission, ample growth opportunities, amazing work-life balance.
cons: Heavy workloads for many, light work for others. Surprising bureaucracy for small org. Top heavy. Siloes across departments (especially Research).

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Flexible. Interesting opportunities to grow internally--new project, speaking engagements, etc. Amazing mission. Sincere co-workers.
cons: Has a history of some transparency issues. Career path can still be confusing. Company is working very hard right now to change them and it feels truly authentic.

pros: The mission, the flexibility, the people
cons: Not enough awareness of  who we are and what we do

review_title: There have been various ups and downs, losing clients and gaining new ones over the years.
pros: The diversity of work and the people make the job a lot easier to manage. They are also pretty flexible about where and when you work.
cons: Complicated management, heavy overhead and not willing to take risks. Various positions are held without real purpose.

review_title: I was able to learn about the organization as a whole and focus on my internproject
pros: Caring Staff, Committed staff, Everyone is into their work and passionate about the cause
cons: Non-profit so the budget is tight and its hard to become involved in multiple things as it was a projec

review_title: The entreneuperial spirit of the company is energizing and motivating.
pros:
Future company growth potential.
Work in a collaborative, team environment.
Challenging, meaningful work.
cons:
Processes not clearly defined, yet they are being addressed.
Communication needs improvement.

pros: You get flexible work timings, managers are helpful and encourages you to learn as much as possible while at work
cons: might feel demotivated because of delays in getting enough tasks to keep you busy, if you're working remotely then it might be difficult to learn deeply about the work culture and engagement

pros: I liked working here. Theres a good vibe and the management of individuals is first class.
cons: Pay is not what it could be. Lunch hours are a joke. Only 10 minutes

pros: Through this internship, interns receive tons of training and have the opportunity to present an overarching presentation to the entire Catalyst staff. The supervisors want to ensure that interns maximize their time at Catalyst and have as meaningful of an experience as possible.
cons: Daily tasks can seem monotonous at times
